Cell.Data: BEAst: This document describes the BEAst profile, and how BEAst's order response messages, version 3.1, for NeC, Rental and Material are linked to the Peppol structure. Peppol: Identifies the specification of content and rules that apply to the transaction.
Identifies the BII profile or business process context in which the transaction appears.

BEAst: T3345, Order response number. Peppol: A transaction instance must have an identifier. The identifier enables referencing the transaction for various purposes such as from other transactions that are part of the same process.
BEAst: T6099, Supplier's Order number. Peppol: An identifier of a referenced sales order, issued by the Seller.
BEAst: T6325, Document Date/Time. Peppol: The date on which the transaction instance was issued.
BEAst: T6325, Document Date/Time. Peppol: The time on which the transaction instance was issued

BEAst: T6114, Order response status. Peppol: A code that indicates whether the referenced order has been received and not yet processed, or is Accepted or Rejected as whole, alternatively, Accepted with change or already delivered. If response code is Accept or Reject there may not be any response lines.
BEAst: T6008 and T6038, Transport information or Supplier's remark. Peppol: Clarification of the suppliers decision.
Response message with amendments in the details
BEAst: T6018, Order Currency. Peppol: The default currency for the offer.

BEAst: T6004, Project number. Peppol: An identifier assigned by the Buyer used for internal routing purposes.The identifier is defined by the buyer (contact ID, department, office id, project code), but provided by the seller in the order response.

BEAst: The order response message always is preceeded by an order message. If the order response is a confirmation of something ordered by telephone, in a shop or a supplier portal, the Peppol message OrderAgreement should be used instead.
BEAst: T3309 and T6335, Reference to the Order/Calloff. Peppol: Used to reference the order that is being responded to.
BEAst: T0009 or T6001, Identification of the Supplier. Peppol: Identifies the seller party's electronic address
Scheme identifier for the electronic address
BEAst: T0009 or T6001, Identification of the Supplier. Peppol: Identifies a party.
BEAst: T5001, Name of the Supplier. Peppol: The name of the party.
BEAst: T0008 or T6001, Identification of the Buyer. Peppol: Identifies the buyer party's electronic address
Scheme identifier for the electronic address
BEAst: T0008 or T6001, Identification of the Buyer. Peppol: An identification for the buyer party.
BEAst: T5001, Name of the Buyer. Peppol: The name of the party who ordered the items and receives the response.
BEAst: Confirmation of delivery dates are always at line level, not here.
The date on which the period starts. The start dates counts as part of the period.
The time at which this period begins. Format = "hh:mm:ss"
The date on which the period ends. The end date counts as part of the period.
The time at which this period end. Format = "hh:mm:ss"

BEAst: Orderlines should be included in the order response only when the OrderResponseCode is "CA" (Conditionally Accepted). For all other codes only the document header should be sent. When the order is Conditionally Accepted, all orderlines shall be included, not only those that are changed.
BEAst: T0051, Line number. Peppol: Identifies the response line. Each order response line MUST be unique within the order response.
BEAst: T6031, Line item information. Peppol: Clarifacation of the suppliers decision for the line.
BEAst: T6115 and T6384, Line Status. Peppol: A code that indicates whether the referenced order line as whole is Accepted or Rejected or, alternatively, Accepted with change.
BEAst: T3240, Quantity to be delivered. unitCode = T6706, Measure Unit NeB Type. Peppol: The quantity of items that will be delivered.
The unit of measure that applies to the ordered quantity.

BEAst: T0059 and T6461, Backordered quantity. Peppol: The quantity of items that will be delivered at a later time. A unit for the backordered quantity is the same as for the Quantity. If none of the remaining quantity for the response line is to be delivered, use 0 "zero".
BEAst: T6319 and T6461, Delivery period Start date. Peppol: The date on which the period starts. The start dates counts as part of the period.
BEAst: T6734, Delivery period Start time. Peppol: The time at which this period begins. Format = "hh:mm:ss"
BEAst: T6320 and T6462, Delivery period End date. Peppol: The date on which the period ends. The end date counts as part of the period.
BEAst: T6735, Delivery period End time. Peppol: The time at which this period end. Format = "hh:mm:ss"

BEAst: T6235, Price amount. currencyID = T6018, Order currency. Peppol: The net price of an item including discounts or surcharges that apply to the price.Although price is an optional element in an offer it recommended as best practice to either state the price or provide reference to an appropriate source from which the price can be identified such as a contract, catalogue or a quote.. The price amount. The net price of the item including all allowances, charges and taxes but exluding TAX.
Currency identifier, must have the same value as element "Document currency".
BEAst: T6722, Price unit basis quantity. unitCode = T6706, Measure Unit NeB Type. Peppol: The actual quantity to which the price applies.
The unit of measure that applies to the base quantity.
BEAst: T6226, Article description. Peppol: A short name given to an item, such as a name from a Catalogue, as distinct from a description. A short name for the item.

BEAst: T6022, T6417 and T0172 if T6317 = "BP", Buyers part article number. Peppol: An identifier, assigned by the buyer, for the item. Associates the item with its identification according to the buyer's system.
BEAst: T0172, Supplier's article number. Peppol: An identifier, assigned by the seller, for the item. Associates the item with its identification according to the seller's system.

BEAst: Global Trade Item Number (T0154) or RSK Article Number Sweden (T6023). All other item number standards used within BEAst can not be used here until the organisation behind the standard decides to be a part of the codelist "ISO 6523 ICD". These are: NOBB Article Number (T6027), RT Article Number (T6460), TUN Article Number (T6028), Finfo/Vilma Article Number (T6029), Norwegian RSK Article Number (T6024), Norwegian E-number (T6026), E-number (T0260) and SGTIN (T6461). Peppol: An item identifier based on a registered scheme. Associates the item with its identification according to a standard system.
Item standard identifier identification scheme identifier
The identification scheme identifier of the Item standard identifier
Substituted line item by the seller
BEAst: T0051, Line number. Peppol: Identifier of the substituted line item

BEAst: T6226, Article description of the replacing article. Peppol: A short name optionally given to an item, such as a name from a Catalogue, as distinct from a description. A short name for the item.

BEAst: T0172, Supplier's article identification of the replacing article. Peppol: An identifier, assigned by the seller, for the item. Associates the item with its identification according to the seller's system.

BEAst: Global Trade Item Number (T0154) or RSK Article Number Sweden (T6023). All other item number standards used within BEAst can not be used here until the organisation behind the standard decides to be a part of the codelist "ISO 6523 ICD". These are: NOBB Article Number (T6027), RT Article Number (T6460), TUN Article Number (T6028), Finfo/Vilma Article Number (T6029), Norwegian RSK Article Number (T6024), Norwegian E-number (T6026), E-number (T0260) and SGTIN (T6461). Peppol: An item identifier based on a registered scheme. Associates the item with its identification according to a standard system.
Item standard identifier identification scheme identifier
The identification scheme identifier of the Item standard identifier
A code for classifying the item by its type or nature. Classification codes are used to allow grouping of similar items for a various purposes e.g. public procurement (CPV), e-Commerce (UNSPSC) etc.
Item classification identifier identification scheme identifier
The identification scheme identifier of the Item classification identifier
Item classification identifier version identification scheme identifier
The identification scheme version identifier of the Item classification identifier
Clear text name equivalent of classification code
The textual equivalent of the code value
The TAX category code for the item.
The TAX percentage rate that applies to the line amount.
A group of business terms providing information about properties of the goods and services invoiced.
The name of the property.The name must be sufficiently descriptive to define the value. The definition may be supplemented with the property unit of measure when relevant.
Code for the item property according to a property code system.
An identifier for the code list used for the Name code, this is bilaterally agreed
The value of the item property.
The unit of measure in which the property value is stated, if relevant. May not be relevant when properties are descriptive.
The unit of measure that applies to the value quantity.
Standardized and predefined classification of items properties.
BEAst: T3322 and T6336, Reference to Order line. Peppol: Used to reference the initial order line that correspondes to the response.All order lines should be stated when an order is changed.
